title: syria_massacre_videos_3-disc-DVD-compilation_NTSC
description:
These ISO files are NTSC DVDs of Syrian war footage from 2011 to 2015.
Most of the clips are immediate-aftermath cell phone video and activist documentation.
Much of it is extremely graphic, bloody and disturbing, for example, completely dismembered
corpses being frantically moved from city streets, chemical weapon burns and blistering,
literally piles and piles of dead Syrian civilians immediately following
airstrikes and barrel bombings, urban streets littered with dead children,
truckloads of dead babies, and so on.

Probably not something you want to watch in polite company without a warning.

If you're not familiar with .ISO files - you can play them in VLC, you can uncompress them with
archiving software to get the .VOB video files out, and you can burn them to DVD-R and DVD+R
discs and play them in your DVD player.

I am slug.root.sx
